item.description: [...] Do you really need API Versioning? - Andreas Krohn reviews the arguments for and against API versioning strategies discussing the problems it tries to solve, as well as looking at how to go about it, and questions if you really need to do it. [...]

item.title: By: Andreas Krohn
item.dc:creator: Andreas Krohn
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/05/14/api-versioning/#comment-183">Bruno Pedro</a>.
I will do some loobying on your behalf on this. I would love to see Andrei write more full blog posts instead of long comment rants. He is a really smart guy that knows what he is talking about.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Bruno Pedro.

I will do some loobying on your behalf on this. I would love to see Andrei write more full blog posts instead of long comment rants. He is a really smart guy that knows what he is talking about.

item.content:encoded:

item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/05/14/api-versioning/#comment-109">Andrei Neculau (@andreineculau)</a>.
Bruno, hook this guy up with an account so he can write some posts!

In reply to Andrei Neculau (@andreineculau).

Bruno, hook this guy up with an account so he can write some posts!

item.title: By: Bruno Pedro
item.dc:creator: Bruno Pedro
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/05/14/api-versioning/#comment-118">Andrei Neculau (@andreineculau)</a>.
You should probably also want to read part one of that article (http://urthen.github.io/2013/05/09/ways-to-version-your-api/) which explains different ways to version an API.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Andrei Neculau (@andreineculau).

You should probably also want to read part one of that article (http://urthen.github.io/2013/05/09/ways-to-version-your-api/) which explains different ways to version an API.
